page.title: 01DOGMERSFIELD AND CROOKHAM
page.content: Population: 1048 ( 1983 figures ) Description: The area contains 2 villages, Dogmersfield and Crookham Village, plus a number of farms.Most of the land is used for farming, a mix of arable and enclosed rough grazing. Much of the area lies within the boundaries of Dogmersfield Park, once the grounds of Dogmersfield House,now farmed. Dogmersfield House, formerly home to the Mildmay family, is now the European headquarters of a computer company. The main recreational facility of the area is the Basingstoke Canal. Local government: Dogmersfield Parish Council Crookham Village Parish Council Hart District Council Hampshire County Council
